reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Developing Marketing Networks in Nicaragua

description.narrative: For agricultural producers and craftsmen living in remote areas the commercialization of their own products is still the biggest challenge in the value chain. The producers and entrepreneurs don?t have a functioning and natural connection to the markets a nd thus they don?t recognize the needs of the buyers, their products don?t have coverage and knowledge of the markets is weak. The competitiveness of the small scale entrepreneurs is weak and their incomes remain low. The first key function of the project is to create a network of permanent places of sales for the products of the cooperatives. That improves the coverage of the products for potential buyers and makes it possible to extend the sales to selected new areas. In addition to the local consumers an other important target group for the sales are the tourists. The places of sales of the sales network also produce information about the markets for small scale entrepreneurs and producers and function as an information desk for commercialization and marke ting related affairs. The capacity of the agricultural producers and craftsmen to act as private entrepreneurs is improved by guidance and they also receive information about markets and important actors. Expected results of the project are: 1) the goods o f the product family ?Manos Nicas? have gained coverage in selected market areas, 2) the places of sales function as a support and information desks for marketing and commercialization, 3) potential markets have been identified for the agricultural product s of the small scale producers in Esteli, Managua and Granada, 4) a functioning cooperation network between craftsmen and women and professional designers 5) all the key actors of the trade network have the basic knowledge of the quality requirements of e xports, the expenses of export and logistics. The project has 44 direct beneficiaries of which 45 per cent are women. It has 370 indirect beneficiaries of which 51 per cent are women. The project is implemented by a local cooperative Cooperativa Multisecto rial Campo Verde Madriz R.L (COMCAVEM R.L) .
